en-locale.Breadth First Search: BFS (Breadth-First Search) is a graph traversal algorithm that visits all the nodes of a graph level by level, exploring all the neighbors of a node before moving on to the next level.
en-locale.Depth First Search: DFS (Depth-First Search) is a graph traversal algorithm that explores as far as possible along each branch before backtracking.
en-locale.Dijkstra: Dijkstra's algorithm is a greedy algorithm that finds the shortest path between nodes in a graph by iteratively selecting the node with the smallest distance from the source node and relaxing its adjacent nodes.
en-locale.Astar: A* is a pathfinding algorithm that finds the shortest path between two points by combining information about the distance from the starting point and estimated distance to the goal.
en-locale.searching: The algorithm is currently searching for the goal
en-locale.building-path: The algorithm found the goal, now it's building path back to origin
en-locale.no-valid-path: Currently there is no valid path in the maze, please rebuild your maze
